question: Sorting is the process of arranging data in a specific order such as ________ or descending.
Sorting helps in making ________ faster, as seen in Binary Search.
Bubble Sort repeatedly compares and swaps ________ elements if they are in the wrong order.
The time complexity of Bubble Sort in the worst case is ________.
In Selection Sort, the algorithm repeatedly selects the ________ element and places it at the correct position.
Insertion Sort builds the sorted array one element at a time by inserting each element at the ________ position.
Quick Sort works by selecting a ________ and partitioning the array into smaller and larger elements.
Merge Sort follows the ________ approach to divide and conquer the sorting problem.
Bubble Sort is considered ________ for large datasets due to its O(n²) complexity.
Selection Sort repeatedly finds the ________ element from the unsorted part and moves it to the sorted part.
Insertion Sort is similar to sorting a deck of ________ in order.
Quick Sort has an average time complexity of ________.
Merge Sort is particularly useful for sorting ________ datasets.
The best-case time complexity of Insertion Sort is ________ when the array is already sorted.
The partition step in Quick Sort ensures that elements smaller than the pivot go to the ________.
Merge Sort first divides the array into smaller parts and then ________ them back together.
Bubble Sort requires ________ swaps in the worst case scenario.
Selection Sort is often used when the dataset size is ________.
The advantage of Quick Sort is its ________ efficiency for large datasets.
Merge Sort is a ________ sorting algorithm.
